alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chenango; Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otsego, central Broome, west central Delaware and Chenango Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greene, or 13 miles northeast of Greater Binghamton Airport, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norwich, Sidney, Guilford, Coventry, Greene, Oxford, Bainbridge, Masonville, Unadilla and Preston. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 88 between 5 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
